name: Jimmy Dane
description: Jimmy Dane is a French chef and author who is the chef and co-owner of Le Bernardin, a Michelin-starred seafood restaurant in New York City.

recipes.name: Boeuf Bourguignon
ingredients: 1 kg beef chuck, cut into chunks
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Preheat the oven to 160°C.
2. In a large casserole dish, fry the bacon until browned. Remove from the dish and set aside.
3. Add the beef to the dish and brown on all sides. Remove and set aside.
4. Fry the onions and garlic in the same dish until softened.
5. Add the carrots, tomato paste, wine, and beef stock. Bring to a boil.
6. Return the beef and bacon to the dish. Add the bouquet garni and season with salt and pepper.
7. Cover and bake in the oven for 3 hours or until the beef is tender.

recipes.name: Ratatouille
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Heat some olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the onions and garlic and fry for a few minutes until softened.
2. Add the peppers, zucchinis, and eggplant. Fry for another 10 minutes.
3. Add the canned tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, salt, and pepper. Bring to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.

recipes.name: Coq au Vin
recipes.cooking_method:
1. In a large casserole dish, fry the bacon until browned. Remove from the dish and set aside.
2. Add the chicken to the dish and brown on all sides. Remove and set aside.
3. Fry the onions and garlic in the same dish until softened.
4. Add the carrots, tomato paste, wine, and chicken stock. Bring to a boil.
5. Return the chicken and bacon to the dish. Add the bouquet garni and season with salt and pepper.
6. Cover and simmer on low heat for 1 hour or until the chicken is tender.

name: Jacques Pépin
description: Jacques Pépin is a French chef, author, and television personality who has written over 30 cookbooks and hosted several television shows.

recipes.name: French Onion Soup
recipes.cooking_method:
1. In a large pot, melt the butter and olive oil over medium heat.
2. Add the onions, salt, and sugar and cook, stirring occasionally, for 45 minutes or until the onions are caramelized.
3. Add the flour and cook for another 2-3 minutes.
4. Add the beef broth, white wine, and black pepper. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
5. Preheat the broiler.
6. Ladle the soup into oven-safe bowls. Top each bowl with a few slices of baguette and sprinkle with the grated Gruyère cheese.
7. Broil for 3-4 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

recipes.name: Beef Bourguignon
ingredients: 2 lb beef chuck, cut into chunks
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Preheat the oven to 325°F.
2. In a large dutch oven, cook the bacon until crisp. Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside.
3. Season the beef with salt and pepper. In the same pot, brown the beef in the bacon fat over medium-high heat. Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside.
4. Add the onions and carrots to the pot and cook until softened. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute.
5. Return the beef and bacon to the pot. Add the beef broth, red wine, tomato paste, thyme, and bay leaf. Bring to a simmer.
6. Cover the pot and bake in the oven for 2-3 hours or until the beef is tender.
7. While the beef is cooking, blanch the pearl onions in boiling water for 1 minute. Drain and let cool. Peel the onions.
8. In a large skillet, sauté the mushrooms in butter until browned. Set aside.
9. When the beef is done, remove the pot from the oven. Skim any fat off the top.
10. Add the pearl onions and mushrooms to the pot. Simmer on the stove for 15-20 minutes or until the onions are tender.
11. Serve hot with crusty bread or over mashed potatoes.

recipes.name: Crème Brûlée
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Preheat the oven to 300°F.
2. In a saucepan, heat the cream, 1/2 cup sugar, and vanilla over medium heat until simmering.
3. In a bowl, whisk the egg yolks.
4. Slowly pour the hot cream mixture into the bowl with the egg yolks, whisking constantly.
5. Pour the mixture into 4 ramekins.
6. Place the ramekins in a baking dish and fill the dish with hot water until it reaches halfway up the sides of the ramekins.
7. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until the custards are set but still slightly jiggly in the center.
8. Remove the ramekins from the baking dish and let cool to room temperature.
9. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of sugar evenly over the top of each custard.
10. Use a kitchen torch to melt and caramelize the sugar until golden brown and crispy.

name: Eric Ripert
description: Eric Ripert is a French chef and author who is the chef and co-owner of Le Bernardin, a Michelin-starred seafood restaurant in New York City.

recipes.name: Scallop Ceviche
recipes.cooking_method:
1. In a bowl, combine the scallops, lime juice, orange juice, jalapeño, and red onion. Mix well and let marinate for 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
2. Drain the scallops and discard the marinade.
3. Arrange the scallops on a platter and sprinkle with cilantro leaves.
4. Season with salt and pepper and drizzle with olive oil.

recipes.name: Pan-Seared Salmon
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Season the salmon fillets with salt and pepper.
2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat.
3. Add the salmon fillets to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side or until cooked through.
4. Remove the salmon from the skillet and keep warm.
5. Add the lemon slices to the skillet and cook for 1-2 minutes.
6. Add the white wine to the skillet and cook for another 1-2 minutes, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom of the skillet.
7. Remove the skillet from the heat and stir in the butter until melted and the sauce is smooth.
8. Spoon the sauce over the salmon fillets and serve.

recipes.name: Bouillabaisse
ingredients: 2 lbs mixed fish (such as snapper, cod, and halibut), cut into chunks
1 leek, white and light green parts only, chopped
recipes.cooking_method:
1. In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
2. Add the onion, leek, garlic, and fennel. Cook for 5-7 minutes or until softened.
3. Add the tomatoes, fish stock, white wine, bay leaf, thyme, and saffron. Bring to a simmer and cook for 20-30 minutes.
4. Add the fish to the pot and season with salt and pepper. Cook for another 10-15 minutes or until the fish is cooked through.
5. Serve hot with crusty bread.

name: Daniel Boulud
description: Daniel Boulud is a French chef and restaurateur who owns several restaurants around the world, including Daniel in New York City, which has been awarded three Michelin stars.

recipes.name: Beef Wellington
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Season the beef tenderloin with salt and pepper.
2. In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium-high heat.
3. Add the shallot and garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes or until softened.
4. Add the mushrooms and cook for another 5-7 minutes or until the mushrooms have released their liquid and are starting to brown.
5. Add the Madeira and cook until the liquid has evaporated.
6. Season with salt and pepper and let cool.
7. Preheat the oven to 400°F.
8. On a lightly floured surface, roll out the puff pastry to a thickness of 1/8 inch.
9. Spread the Dijon mustard over the puff pastry.
10. Spread the mushroom mixture over the mustard.
11. Place the beef tenderloin in the center of the puff pastry and fold the pastry over the beef, sealing the edges.
12. Brush the pastry with the beaten egg.
13. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the pastry is golden brown and the beef is cooked to your liking.
14. Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.

recipes.name: Lobster Thermidor
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F.
2. Cut the lobster tails in half lengthwise.
3. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat.
4. Add the shallot and garlic and cook for 1-2 minutes or until softened.
5. Whisk in the flour and cook for another minute.
6. Gradually whisk in the milk and white wine, stirring constantly until the mixture is smooth and thickened.
7. Stir in the Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper.
8. Arrange the lobster tails in a baking dish and spoon the sauce over them.
9. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the lobster is cooked through and the sauce is golden brown and bubbly.
10. Sprinkle with chopped parsley before serving.

recipes.name: Poulet Rôti
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F.
2. Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
3. Stuff the lemon quarters, thyme, rosemary, and garlic cloves into the cavity of the chicken.
4. Rub the softened butter over the skin of the chicken.
5. Place the chicken in a roasting pan and roast for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until the internal temperature of the chicken reaches 165°F.
6.Let rest for 10 minutes before carving and serving.

name: Julia Child
description: Julia Child was an American chef, author, and television personality who introduced French cuisine to the American public through her cookbook 'Mastering the Art of French Cooking' and her TV show 'The French Chef'.

recipes.name: Beef Bourguignon
ingredients: 2 lbs beef chuck, cut into chunks
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F.
2. In a large casserole dish, fry the bacon until browned. Remove from the dish and set aside.
3. Add the beef to the dish and brown on all sides. Remove and set aside.
4. Fry the onion and garlic in the same dish until softened.
5. Add the carrots, tomato paste, wine, beef stock, thyme, rosemary, bay leaf, and bacon. Bring to a boil.
6. Return the beef to the dish. Season with salt and pepper.
7. Cover and bake in the oven for 3 hours or until the beef is tender.
8. While the beef is cooking, blanch the pearl onions in boiling water for 1 minute. Drain and let cool. Peel the onions.
9. In a large skillet, sauté the mushrooms in butter until browned. Set aside.
10. When the beef is done, remove the pot from the oven. Skim any fat off the top.
11. Add the pearl onions and mushrooms to the pot. Simmer on the stove for 15-20 minutes or until the onions are tender.
12. Serve hot with crusty bread or over mashed potatoes.

recipes.name: Quiche Lorraine
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F.
2. Roll out the pie crust and place it in a 9-inch pie dish. Trim the edges.
3. In a skillet, fry the bacon until browned. Remove from the skillet and set aside.
4. In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, heavy cream, nutmeg, salt, and pepper.
5. Spread the bacon over the bottom of the pie crust.
6. Pour the egg mixture over the bacon.
7. Sprinkle the grated Gruyere cheese over the top.
8. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until the filling is set and the top is golden brown.
9. Let cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

recipes.name: Coq au Vin
recipes.cooking_method:
1. In a large casserole dish, fry the bacon until browned. Remove from the dish and set aside.
2. Add the chicken to the dish and brown on all sides. Remove and set aside.
3. Fry the onions and garlic in the same dish until softened.
4. Add the carrots, tomato paste, wine, and chicken stock. Bring to a boil.
5. Return the chicken and bacon to the dish. Add the bouquet garni and season with salt and pepper.
6. Cover and simmer on low heat for 1 hour or until the chicken is tender.

name: Anne-Sophie Pic
description: Anne-Sophie Pic is a French chef who is the owner and head chef of the restaurant Maison Pic in Valence, France. She is the fourth female chef to earn three Michelin stars.

recipes.name: Lamb Shanks
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Preheat the oven to 350°F.
2. Season the lamb shanks with salt and pepper.
3. In a large Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat.
4. Add the lamb shanks and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side or until browned. Remove the lamb shanks from the pot and set aside.
5. Add the onion, carrots, celery, and garlic to the pot. Cook for 5-7 minutes or until softened.
6. Add the red wine, beef stock, tomato paste, and bouquet garni to the pot. Bring to a boil.
7. Return the lamb shanks to the pot. Cover and bake in the oven for 2-3 hours or until the lamb is tender.
8. In a small bowl,whisk together the cornstarch and cold water.
9. Remove the lamb shanks from the pot and keep warm.
10. Bring the sauce to a boil on the stovetop. Whisk in the cornstarch mixture and cook for a few minutes or until the sauce thickens.
11. Serve the lamb shanks with the sauce and garnish with chopped fresh parsley.

recipes.name: Crème Brûlée
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Preheat the oven to 325°F.
2. In a saucepan, heat the heavy cream, 1/2 cup granulated sugar, and vanilla extract over medium heat. Cook until the sugar has dissolved.
3. In a separate bowl, whisk the egg yolks until smooth.
4. Gradually whisk the hot cream mixture into the egg yolks.
5. Pour the mixture into six 6-ounce ramekins.
6. Place the ramekins in a large baking dish. Fill the baking dish with enough hot water to come halfway up the sides of the ramekins.
7. Bake for 30-40 minutes or until the custards are set.
8. Remove the ramekins from the baking dish and let cool.
9. Chill the custards in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours.
10. Before serving, sprinkle 1 tablespoon of granulated sugar over each custard. Use a kitchen torch to melt and caramelize the sugar.
11. Let cool for a few minutes before serving.

recipes.name: Chocolate Soufflé
recipes.cooking_method:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F.
2. Butter and sugar four 6-ounce ramekins.
3. In a double boiler, melt the chocolate and butter over low heat. Stir until smooth.
4. In a separate saucepan, whisk together the 1/4 cup granulated sugar and flour.
5. Gradually whisk in the milk until smooth.
6. Cook the milk mixture over medium heat, whisking constantly, until it thickens.
7. Remove the milk mixture from the heat and whisk in the melted chocolate mixture.
8. Whisk in the egg yolks.
9. In a separate bowl, beat the egg whites and cream of tartar until soft peaks form.
10. Gradually beat in the 1/4 cup granulated sugar until stiff peaks form.
11. Fold the egg whites into the chocolate mixture.
12. Spoon the mixture into the prepared ramekins.
13. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the soufflés are puffed and set.
14. Serve immediately.
